conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: good morning missus smith how are you feeling today

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: good morning doctor i've been better i suppose i've been feeling my heart race quite a bit lately and it's making me feel a bit dizzy and weak

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: i'm sorry to hear that let's talk about it in detail when did you first notice these symptoms

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i suppose it started a few weeks ago but it's been getting worse

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: any chest pain shortness of breath or fainting spells

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: no chest pain but i do feel winded quite easily

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: have you noticed any triggers or patterns for example does the racing heart happen after you've exerted yourself

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: not necessarily it seems to come on quite randomly

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: i see i'd like to run a few tests including an egg and possibly an echocardiogram to check your heart's rhythm and to see how it's pumping blood we may also do a stress test if needed

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: after examination your heart rate is indeed a bit elevated and irregular you have ventricular tachycardia missus smith it's a condition where the lower chambers of your heart beat too fast causing inefficient blood flow

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: oh that sounds serious what can we do about it

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: we have some effective treatment options including medications to control your heart rhythm and possibly a procedure called catheter ablation if necessary lifestyle changes like reducing caffeine and alcohol could also help

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i see and what's the next step doctor thank you doctor i'll follow your recommendations
